title: 5 great shows to watch on Netflix this week
text:
Netflix has more original series and classic TV shows than the average person can keep up with. To help parse through the options, Insider is here to recommend five shows that are actually worth your time this week.

First up is a brand new series you won't want to miss out on.

'The Politician'

Ben Platt stars on Netflix's satirical drama "The Politician." Netflix

Seasons: 1

Episodes: 8

"The Politician" premieres on Friday, and it's one of Netflix's newest series that's most worth giving a watch.

Equal parts drama, satire, and comedy, the show tells the story of an ambitious young man who is determined to one day be President of the United States — but is currently still trying to win the role of student body president in high school.

Read more: 'The Politician,' a heartwarming and funny new Netflix series, is Ryan Murphy's best show to date

'Ozark'

Jason Bateman won an Emmy for best directing on a drama show for "Ozark" season two. Netflix

Seasons: 2

Episodes: 20

"Ozark" made waves on Sunday evening when both Jason Bateman and Julia Garner won Emmys for the Netflix series, beating out "Game of Thrones" in the process. If you've never watched this drama about a family drawn into a world of crime, now is a good time to catch up and see what all the hype is all about.

Read more: The 10 biggest snubs and surprises of this year's Emmys

'Godless'

Jeff Daniels on Netflix's original drama "Godless." Netflix

Seasons: 1

Episodes: 7

This limited series stars Jeff Daniels ("The Newsroom"), Michelle Dockery ("Downton Abbey"), and Merritt Wever ("Unbelievable"). With its stellar cast and gripping Western setting, "Godless" tells the story of an old mining town run primarily by women and their fight against a band of outlaws.

Read more: The 43 best Netflix original TV shows this year so far, ranked

'Wild Wild Country'

"It's a tale so wild that seeing means barely believing," Netflix's synopsis for "Wild Wild Country" says. Netflix

Seasons: 1

Episodes: 6

If you're more in the mood for a documentary series and haven't yet seen "Wild Wild Country," now is a good time to fix that. This six-episode series goes deep into the story of a controversial guru leader who ran a would-be Utopian city in Oregon.

Read more: What to know before watching 'Wild Wild Country' — Netflix's docu-series about a 'sex cult'

'Frasier'

Kelsey Grammer as seen on the pilot episode of "Frasier." NBC

Seasons: 11

Episodes: 264

Netflix has a great catalogue of classic TV sitcoms from other networks, and NBC's "Fraiser" is among the best of the bunch. The show originally ran from 1993 to 2004 as a spinoff from "Cheers" (which is also streaming on Netflix right now) and tells the story of a man trying to rebuild his life in his hometown of Seattle.

Though "Friends" gets the most attention these days as new generations discover it, "Frasier" is well-worth revisiting as an iconic sitcom.

For more Netflix options, read Insider's list of the best movies you can stream this week.
description: Insider recommends streaming new series "The Politician," Emmy-winning drama "Ozark," plus "Godless," "Wild Wild Country," and "Frasier."
